p: Another researcher investigated whether fermented ginger (FG) had a neuroprotective effect in an AD mouse model. These researchers found that FG alleviated memory dysfunction induced by the Aβ 1−42 plaque toxicity and inhibited Aβ 1−42 plaque-induced neuronal cell loss in the CA3 region of the hippocampus. Thus, these studies showed the antiamnesic effects of FG against the Aβ 1−42 plaque toxicity by inhibiting neuronal cell loss and synaptic disturbance, besides suggesting that FG can alleviate AD-like memory dysfunction and neuronal degradation [ 36].
